column6: Chief Executive of the Horserace Betting Levy Board (HBLB), a statutory body established by the Betting Levy Act 1961 and now operating in accordance with the provisions of the Betting, Gaming and Lotteries Act 1963 (as amended). Unlike some other non-departmental public bodies, the HBLB receives no central Government grant-in-aid and no National Lottery funding and its employees are not civil servants. Its role is to assess and collect monetary contributions from bookmakers and the Tote successor company via a levy, which it then distributes for the improvement of horseracing and breeds of horses and for the advancement of veterinary science and education.
column7: Department for Culture, Media and Sport
column19: (1) HBLB employees are not civil servants and HBLB receives no central Government grant-in-aid and no National Lottery funding        (2) The combined salary cost of reporting posts has been rounded to the nearest 100,000 pounds.
